description: A 4f orbital characterized by complex, asymmetrical lobes due to its magnetic quantum number, m_l = 1, indicating a unique orientation.
orientation: asymmetrical arrangement with respect to the nucleus, indicating directional electron probability distribution

nodes.orientation: asymmetrically oriented planes through the nucleus
nodes.description: Planar nodes creating distinct, asymmetrical lobes, reflecting the m_l = 1 influence on electron distribution.
Radial nodes that define regions of zero electron probability, highlighting the unique radial distribution characteristic of 4f orbitals.
